thread.title: Rugby union players Ali Williams and James O'Connor arrested in Paris | Sport | The Guardian
thread.title_full: Rugby union players Ali Williams and James O'Connor arrested in Paris | Sport | The Guardian

author: Associated Press
title: Rugby union players Ali Williams and James O'Connor arrested in Paris | Sport | The Guardian
text:
Rugby union players Ali Williams and James O'Connor arrested in Paris Former international rugby players allegedly tried to buy cocaine Paris prosecutor’s office confirms pair were arrested on Saturday Ali Williams was arrested in Paris along with James O’Connor. Photograph: Kazuhiro Nogi/AFP/Getty Images View more sharing options Associated Press Saturday 25 February 2017 13.38 GMT 
The former All Black lock Ali Williams and former Australia back James O’Connor have been arrested in Paris after allegedly trying to buy cocaine near a nightclub. 
Confirming media reports, the Paris prosecutor’s office said Williams and O’Connor were arrested at around 3am local time on Saturday. 
Williams, who won the 2015 World Cup with New Zealand, currently plays with French club Racing 92. O’Connor is contracted to another Top 14 club, Toulon. 
The arrests came only days after another former All Black, Dan Carter, was forced to apologise for “a massive error of judgment” after he allegedly failed a drink-driving test in France .
